p: Outpatient (monthly, all ages) and IDSR (weekly under-5) diarrheal data demographics are shown in Table 2. For the outpatient data, diarrheal outbreak patterns were similar in both under-5 children and in older children and adults, with diarrheal disease in individuals â‰¥ 5 years representing almost half of the reported cases. Significant differences in diarrhea type were identified when outpatient data were stratified by age ( Table 3). However, more than half of the diarrheal cases across age groups presented with some or severe dehydration or bloody diarrhea ( Table 3).
